Async Facit API
  • Examples
  • View page source

Examples

If you dont already got a loop in your programm you need to create one. Here is a basic example which will search players by the username and prints out a dict witch the nicknames and player_ids:

 1import asyncio
 2from src.async_faceit_api import FaceitAPI
 3
 4
 5async def my_task():
 6    api_key = "..."  # Set your api key here
 7    api = FaceitAPI(api_key)
 8    players = await api.search_players("username")
 9    print({player.nickname: player.player_id for player in players.items})
10
11
12if __name__ == "__main__":
13    loop = asyncio.new_event_loop()
14    loop.run_until_complete(my_task())
15    loop.close()

Its recomended to store the api_key somewhere safe (e.g in an .env file)!

Here is another example on how you can implement the api by subclassing and using a “.env” file. Note that this example also shows you how you can use “asyncio.gather()” to increase the speed of your code, if you want to do multiple independent requests.

 1import asyncio
 2import datetime
 3import os
 4
 5from dotenv import load_dotenv
 6
 7from src.async_faceit_api import FaceitAPI
 8from src.async_faceit_api.dataclasses import MatchStats
 9from src.async_faceit_api.enums import Game
10
11load_dotenv()
12
13
14class MyApi(FaceitAPI):
15    def __init__(self):
16        # include a ".env" file with "faceit_api_key=YOUR_API_KEY" in it
17        api_key = os.getenv('faceit_api_key')
18        super().__init__(api_key)
19
20    async def get_played_maps(self, player_id):
21        matches = await self.player_history(player_id, Game.CS_GO)
22        maps = {}
23        for match in matches.items:
24            map_ = await self.match_stats(match.match_id)
25            if map_ in maps:
26                maps[map_] += 1
27            else:
28                maps[map_] = 1
29        return maps
30
31    async def get_played_maps_parallel(self, player_id):
32        matches = await self.player_history(player_id, Game.CS_GO)
33        tasks = [self.match_stats(match.match_id) for match in matches.items]
34        all_match_stats = await asyncio.gather(*tasks)
35        maps = {}
36        for match_stat in all_match_stats:
37            match_stat: MatchStats
38            map_ = match_stat.rounds[0].round_stats['Map']
39            if map_ in maps:
40                maps[map_] += 1
41            else:
42                maps[map_] = 1
43        return maps
44
45
46async def my_task():
47    api = MyApi()
48    player_id = "..."  # add a faceit id here
49    time = datetime.datetime.now()
50    print(await api.get_played_maps(player_id))
51    print(datetime.datetime.now() - time)
52    time = datetime.datetime.now()
53    print(await api.get_played_maps_parallel(player_id))
54    print(datetime.datetime.now() - time)
55
56
57if __name__ == "__main__":
58    loop = asyncio.new_event_loop()
59    loop.run_until_complete(my_task())
60    loop.close()
